metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6171 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
checkpassword-reply in Dovecot before 2.2.7 performs setuid operations to a user who is authenticating, which allows local users to bypass authentication and access virtual email accounts by attaching to the process and using a restricted file descriptor to modify account information in the response to the dovecot-auth server.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-core - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-solr - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dovecot package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2').
